data.title: David Robbins Obituary
data.meta_description: VENICE, Fla. - David F. Robbins, 79, a Pepperell native and former Nashua business owner who was a veteran of World War II, died Saturday, Feb. 28, at Fishe
data.text:
David F. Robbins OBITUARY

VENICE, Fla. – David F. Robbins, 79, a Pepperell native and former Nashua business owner who was a veteran of World War II, died Saturday, Feb. 28, at Fishermen’s Hospital in Marathon. He was the husband of the late Loretta Y. (Senecal) Robbins.

He was born in Pepperell on Dec. 2, 1924, a son of the late Roger S. and Lydia (Waite) Robbins of Pepperell. He was educated in the Pepperell school system.

Mr. Robbins served in the Navy during World War II, and was assigned to South Pacific on the destroyer escort USS Robert F. Keller. He attained the rank of chief petty officer.

After serving in the Navy, Mr. Robbins settled in Nashua, where he worked at Nashua Corp. for 25 years. He also owned a trucking business in Nashua.

He retired in 1988 to Venice, where he lived with his companion, Betty Ulbin, who died in November 2002.

He most recently moved to Little Torch Key, where he was cared for by his son, John Robbins and his fiancŽe, June Frye.

Mr. Robbins held memberships in the American Legion James E. Coffey Post 3 and Club National, both of Nashua. He was a 32nd degree Mason and a member of the Bektash Temple Shrine.

He is survived by four sons and a daughter-in-law, David P. Robbins of Laguna Beach, Calif., Peter Robbins of Nashua, John Robbins and his fiancŽe, June Frye of Little Torch Key, and Dana Robbins and his wife Kathryn of Hollis, N.H.; five grandchildren, Christopher Robbins and his wife Danielle of Bellport, N.Y., Ashley Robbins of Dana Point, Calif., Kami Friday and her husband Kristopher of Nashua, and Vanessa and John Robbins of Hollis, N.H.; two brothers, Roger Robbins Jr. and Charles Robbins, both of Pepperell. He also leaves a brother-in-law, Hector Senecal Jr. and his wife Rita of Nashua; a sister-in-law, Margaret Carlson of Encinitas, Calif.; and several nieces and nephews.
